results.title: Blood disco: Dirk wears white socks
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Scott Redford
results.brief_description: Scott Redford’s visually rampant fist-in-mouth and Egyptian eye images riff on the early surrealist films of Luis Buñuel, via a queer punk aesthetic, in this pop-savvy work.

results.title: A 30 second portrait, starring Phil Lombardo
results.creator_credit: SBS Independent, ACMI and Cherine Fahd
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: Cherine Fahd’s loving and gently funny video portrait of Phil Lombardo, a young man obsessed with Michael Jackson, continues her visual investigation into the politics of personal identity.

results.title: You've got to work for it (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A film made by six Diploma of Education students (Bob Sharples, Kamal Monsour, Sally Ford, Derek Burrage, Denis Connolly and Doug Eastman) about the problem migrant adolescents face in Australia. Through group discussions between Italian immigrants, Greek immigrants and first generation immigrant children, a real portrayal of the frustration of immigrant teenagers growing up in Australia is shown. Also gives a brief background history of Greek/Italian migration in the 1960’s and 1970’s from an economical/political point of view. Broadmeadows
results.description: A film made by six Diploma of Education students (Bob Sharples, Kamal Monsour, Sally Ford, Derek Burrage, Denis Connolly and Doug Eastman) about the problem migrant adolescents face in Australia. Also gives a brief background history of Greek/Italian migration in the 1960’s and 1970’s from an economical/political point of view. Broadmeadows

results.title: The Seven bridges of Koenigsberg
results.creator_credit: Bruce Cornwell and International Film Bureau
results.brief_description: An animated film concerned with solving the problem of crossing the seven bridges of Konigsberg, Germany, in a single continuous walk. Early attempts to solve it by trial and error are shown, including Leonard Euler’s analysis of the problem. This is a claerly explained and attractive film which would complement a study on topology or network theory. No other credits available. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Autism: who cares
results.brief_description: Four centres for autistic children in Victoria show how they deal with this problem. Details how they are able to teach the children to eventually integrate into the community. Photographer: Leigh Tilson; Music: Franciscus Henri, Philip Gardner, Audrey Klein.

results.title: Touch the Sun: Peter and Pompey
results.creator_credit: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description: Peter, Margaret and Wayne discover a Roman boat in a cave that contains the manuscript of young Pompey. The discovery changes the tiny little town of Gamma into a brash, hyped-up tourist centre. The children also find that their lives change too - and they don’t like what is happening. The manuscript found in the boat reveals that the boat is cursed and, until the boat is destroyed it will continue to curse anyone who comes into contact with it. The children decide that in order to save Gamma they must finally carry out the drastic act of destroying the boat.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Carson, Margot McDonald and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: Wild about wilderness
results.creator_credit: David Greig and Kestrel Films & Video (Australia)
results.brief_description: Debora Conway hosts this video which attempts to define wilderness areas that are left. All wilderness areas shown are from New South Wales. Finishes with the sobering thought that what we don’t save now is lost for ever.

results.title: Gunpowder man
results.creator_credit: John Richardson and Eastern Suburb's Children's Film Group
results.brief_description: Two boys secretly build a Guy Fawkes. A third boy follows them, discovers their secret and reveals it to his friends. A fight for ownership ensues but stops when the Guy collapses. All join together to re-react it and happily share the firing on Guy Fawkes night.
